aws::graph::propositions: Amazon's Cybersecurity Risk Management and Organizational Structure
Amazon uses processes to oversee and identify material risks from cybersecurity threats associated with third-party technology and systems.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for encryption and authentication.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for employee email.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for content delivery to customers.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for back-office support.
Amazon uses third-party technology and systems for other functions.
Amazon conducts application security assessments as part of its risk management process.
Amazon conducts vulnerability management as part of its risk management process.
Amazon conducts penetration testing as part of its risk management process.
Amazon conducts security audits as part of its risk management process.
Amazon conducts ongoing risk assessments as part of its risk management process.
Amazon maintains a variety of incident response plans.
Amazon's incident response plans are utilized when incidents are detected.
Amazon requires employees with access to information systems to undertake data protection training annually.
Amazon requires employees with access to information systems to undertake cybersecurity training annually.
Amazon requires employees with access to information systems to complete compliance programs annually.
Amazon requires all corporate employees to undertake data protection training annually.
Amazon requires all corporate employees to undertake cybersecurity training annually.
Amazon requires all corporate employees to complete compliance programs annually.
Amazon has a unified and centrally-coordinated team responsible for implementing cybersecurity practices.
Amazon has a unified and centrally-coordinated team responsible for maintaining centralized cybersecurity practices.
Amazon has a unified and centrally-coordinated team responsible for implementing data protection practices.
Amazon has a unified and centrally-coordinated team responsible for maintaining data protection practices.
Amazon's centrally-coordinated team is led by Amazon's chief security officer.
Amazon's chief security officer works in close coordination with senior leadership.
Amazon's chief security officer works in close coordination with other teams across Amazon.
A number of experienced chief information security officers report to Amazon's chief security officer.
Amazon's chief information security officers are responsible for various parts of Amazon's business.
Amazon Web Services (AWS) has a chief information security officer.
Each chief information security officer is supported by a team of trained cybersecurity professionals.

Amazon's chief security officer works in close coordination with other teams across Amazon.
A number of experienced chief information security officers report to Amazon's chief security officer.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) has a chief information security officer.
Each chief information security officer is supported by a team of trained cybersecurity professionals.

text:
Additionally, we use processes to oversee and identify material risks from cybersecurity threats associated with our use of third-party technology and systems, including: technology and systems we use for encryption and authentication; employee email; content delivery to customers; back-office support; and other functions .

As part of our risk management process, we conduct application security assessments, vulnerability management, penetration testing, security audits, and ongoing risk assessments. We also maintain a variety of incident response plans that are utilized when incidents are detected. We require employees with access to information systems, including all corporate employees, to undertake data protection and cybersecurity training and compliance programs annually.

We have a unified and centrally-coordinated team, led by our chief security officer, that is responsible for implementing and maintaining centralized cybersecurity and data protection practices at Amazon in close coordination with senior leadership and other teams across Amazon.Reporting to our chief security officer are a number of experienced chief information security officers responsible for various parts of our business, including AWS, each of whom is supported by a team of trained cybersecurity professionals.
